text: Which terms are used in shaders and materials to refer to the color of an object?

options.text: Diffuse map, base map, and albedo
Diffuse map and specular map, and metallic map
Base map, normal map, and albedo
Base map, normal map, and specular map

feedbackCorrect: The URP/Lit Shader calls for a Base Map to specify color. Other shaders commonly call this property Albedo or Diffuse Map (even though, technically, these terms donâ€™t mean exactly the same thing).
feedbackIncorrect: Shaders and materials work together to define all the characteristics of a mesh surface during the rendering process. A material is an asset that works with a shader to define how meshes will be rendered.
